name: Doubletree by Hilton Charlottesville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one room with a king size bed and were impressed by how much space our room had. Everything was very clean. The staff were friendly. A little far away from the center of the city but having a car made things easier. The parking lot was very convenient.
reviews.title: Nice rooms!

reviews.text: Stayed for a business visit last month. The hotel is very well kept and their restaurant is open till late. I like to grab a bite whenever I am working late. The hotel is always full, which tells me people like coming back and staying with them. Will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great stay as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Doubletree ranks a 5 in my travel experience! From the time you check in, the service is wonderful! TJ's resturant has a good variety to choose from and the food is excellent! The rooms are very clean and spacious! The choice of pillows is excellent!
reviews.title: Great location for the C'Ville area

reviews.text: Overall, this is a great hotel to stay at but I feel like there were a few things that dampened my enthusiasm to stay here again.
reviews.title: Okay stay, a few things people should consider

reviews.text: First, it seems like there is a lack of attention to detail by the maintenance personnel at the hotel. My hotel sink had a large blob of pink putty (presumably to seal the gap between the sink and the counter) along the back of the sink. I also could not figure out why there is a wall thermostat that does nothing. If you want to change the temperature, you must walk up to the wall AC unit. In the fitness center, one of the treadmills had a broken increase volume button for the personal TV.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, a little outside Charlottesville city center

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Doubletree on a trip to visit our niece at UVA.......it was homecoming weekend and it was busy around town. The Hotel itself is about 5 miles from campus and is a straight shot down Rt. 29 to get there. We checked in with little problems and staff seemed attentative and well trained. The Hotel itself is attractive with plenty of parking....lobby was very nice and the lounge area off the lobby was clean and very busy. The room itself was average at best and seemed very small....but it was clean.The walls between the rooms must be paper thin since we heard the people in the room next to us as if they were in our room. I have stayed at other Doubletrees across USA and never see the appeal ...... the other hotels in the Hilton chain always seem better to me. For the price....189/night+......I know there are better options out there!
reviews.title: OK.......must be better choices out there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Charlottesville while visiting Monticello, Doubltree offers an excellent full service hotel at a reasonable price. The only exception was that the front desk had difficulty locating a bellman upon arrival and we were shown where the bell carts were parked.
reviews.title: Excellent Full Service Hotel

reviews.text: The quality of the linen and bedding are at the high Hilton standard. We were fortunate enough to be "upgraded" to the executive level, 9th floor. The good news was that we then had access to the executive lounge for appetizers and complimentary drinks in the evening.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad news is that we were in room 900, immediatley next to that lounge. Breakfast and the door banging started at 0630h daily.
reviews.title: Visit to Monticello

reviews.text: We did enjoy the views from the 9th floor and a handfull of deer grazing behind the hotel.
reviews.title: Way Better than Expected

reviews.text: The Hilton Doubletree is hidden back, almost out of sight. It is a beautiful hotel with an understated elegance that renders it totally comfortable.
reviews.title: A Hidden-away Gem

reviews.text: Many may have experienced this at other properties but this is the first one that called the room within 30 minutes of our check in and asked if we were pleased with our accommodations. What a nice touch! Everything we were expecting was right there.
reviews.title: Family Vacation

reviews.text: My ONLY issue is that the parking lot is poorly lighted, separated from a very busy road by a narrow row of trees, is rather secluded from the view of the hotel staff/front office/desk. Apparently there have been numerous cases of cars being burglarized as they have signs everywhere warning that they are not responsible for the safety and security of your vehicle. This factor makes for a little bit of a restless night; and we checked in to sleep, not watch out the window to insure that our car was not the target of thugs.
reviews.title: Doubletree

reviews.text: This is a very well kept hotel. My only concern was that it did not offer an in-room safe. Otherwise, the staff was helpful and the room was very nice. The front desk staff were very professional. Our reservations were done quickly and our room was ready when we arrived.
reviews.title: Superb! Highly Recommend!

reviews.text: The hotel could be better marked from Rt 29. The Hotel Staff is very professional and accomidating. We needed a roll away bed, and it was very swiftly put in the room with no additional charge. The rooms are clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: good for overnight stay with family

reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 night in November 2012. From the outside, the hotel looks like it would be rather plain and "blah." It looks like an older hotel; clean but old and unremarkable. But once you step inside, it is actually quite nice. I was here for a conference and the conference rooms were clean and well-kept with good temperature control. I didn't see people shivering or sweating. The lobby was very clean and modern. The inside of the hotel looks quite different from what I expected from the outside. The food was nice and the room itself was great. The staff was friendly and offered a warm cookie upon arrival. When I locked myself out, they replaced my key in about 14 seconds with a smile.
reviews.title: Great stay at Doubletree

reviews.text: I had 1 King bed on the 7th floor overlooking the parking lot to Sam's Club and the mountains. There are only 2 elevators and while they move swiftly, there were times where there was a bit of a wait. The bed was super comfortable and the room was a good size. There was a desk with internet port, a sofa, coffee table and a flat screen TV. Importantly, the room has free wi-fi that operates reasonably well. Streaming video from Youtube hiccuped a few times on my ipad, but loading up basic web pages and sending emails was no problem.
reviews.title: It's OK, Nothing Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice. and clean. I hate peeling wallpaper, water stains and dirty grout. This was entirely the opposite. Everything was pristine and both the bathroom and main room have trash baskets that let you separate out paper recycling. No weird noises, no weird smells. It was a very nice, clean room.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't swim but the pool set-up is a bit weird. It is on the lobby level and everyone in the lobby or restaurant can see you swimming. The exercise room is very small with just a few pieces of equipment but everything seemed to be in working order.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The location itself is pretty good in that it is just down the street from quite a few restaurants,strip malls and a mall. Chik-fila, Walmart, Red Robin, Panera, Outback, Jimmy Johns, Asian buffet restaurants and a bunch of other things are very close by. None of it is the cute, picturesque scene you'd fine near the UVA campus, but it is functional. Great location for business but not necessarily for the quaint little weekend getaway. Not so great for romantic outings.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at this hotel!

description: Doubletree by Hilton Charlottesville is located just minutes from the University of Virginia, John Paul Jones arena, Charlottesville Regional Airport and Monticello. Recently renovated in 2008, the Doubletree by Hilton Charlottesville was named one of Expedia’s Insider's Select Hotels and Reader's Choice Hotel by the Daily Progress.
